Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rachel693
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel more for the Kitchen in the suite rather than location. We arrived and was checked in by a very nice lady who spoke good English. We were given our room key and proceeded to our suite. When I walked in, I noticed that there was not kitchen in the suite which is what I had asked for, so I went down to reception and stated that I had booked that specific suite for the kitchen so I could make my children breakfast in the morning as I wasn't pay the 17€ each that the hotel wanted in their restaurant. I was told that some suites have kitchens some dont and that they were fully booked for the period of our stay, so when I then asked for my money back and we'd go elsewhere, they funnily enough found us another suite accross the corridor! But we were told that the cooker and hob would not work! This suite was nice, had 2 rooms a kitchen and a bathroom. On further inspection of the kitchen there was not a utensil or piece of crockery insight! So we had to go to the little arcade down the street and buy plastic bowls, spoons, knives and forks so we could make our children food in the morning! Overall the Suite was nice, basic for what you need and the shower was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel…Misses outstanding by a couple of points”
Reviews.Author: Ben T
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I stayed at this hotel during the first week in Apr. The hotel was nice and clean. The room was very open and large. The location was great there were a U-bahn stop close by, with a mall that had a grocery store and a few restaurants right underneath and around. The front desk staff was very nice and minus one thing was very helpful. I would recommend staying here if you have a family, or if you have a need for lots of space. It was great to have a room that my family and I were not standing on top of each other. Now for the few things that need to be improved. We shipped out luggage to the hotel before we arrived. We called the hotel to ensure that they would accept the luggage before we checked in. When we arrived in the mid afternoon, I asked about our luggage and told it wasn’t there. Not worried yet as the delivery company still had time. Dropped our backpacks in the room and went for a walk to see the area. We came back and asked again still no. Now I’m worried. So we went to the room and cleaned up and checked on line for the status. According to the shipper he had arrived and been delivered around noon that day. So we went back down and asked for the third time. They went back and hunted for it and finally found our luggage. The staff was nice about it and apologized, but still having to go and ask three different times when it was there the whole time was a bit taxing. The other issue for our room was the balcony. Or lack of access to it. When we got there we went to the room and saw the door for the balcony. One of the main reasons we booked here was the balcony. We are early risers and wanted to be able to talk and have coffee without waking our son. Our reservation said the room had a balcony. We went to the balcony door and there was no door handle. When we asked the hotel about it, they told us sorry that room doesn’t have one. No offer to move us, not explanation as to why just tough luck. We didn’t push the issue as we were tiered from travel and had just gotten our luggage. (See above). All and all this was a great hotel, just a few things to make it outstanding. If we go to Berlin again we will consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money - but internet a real issue”
Reviews.Author: stephantravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice last year. Overall, I was really impressed with the size of the rooms, how quiet they are, and really liked the location too. For a fee, you can get access to a large and well equipped gym just next door. Staff was, in general, on the friendly side. I very much appreciated the fact they accepted to give me late checkout without even hesitating (and I am not a goldcard holder or anything like that with Ramada). The only major issue I had was the wireless connection not working properly. It seems that, the farther away from reception you are, the weaker the wireless signal, to the extent that you won't have any if you are in one of the rooms towards the end of the corridor. If you rely on the internet a lot, this can really be a deal breaker, as it was for me after my second stay at this hotel. You can get great prepaid deals on www.hotel.de

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: colonialk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights as part of a tour group. I was somewhat concerned that it was in the middle of no where and there would be nothing around. Was I wrong! About 100 yards from the hotel there were two very walkable streets with konditorei, shopping mall with grocery store, and restaurants. The staff was very helpful and spoke very good English. Breakfast buffet was abundant. Our room included a large bath, living room with chairs,desk and couch and a kitchen for making coffee and tea. Overall much better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lolly2909
Reviews.Content: Very big, clean and comfortable rooms, all staff speak next to perfect English. We got a good deal on booking.com, so we payed half of the normal price. One of the downfalls is that the hotel claims to have a swimming pool. What thay actually mean is that there is a swimming pool and fitness center nextdoor to the hotel, and you have to pay 10 euros per person, per day to use any of it. (10 euros to use a swimming pool for an hour or so is, i think, very steep) Also, under 18 year olds are not allowed in! The breakfast was soooo good! They had such a big choice! The only thing that wasn't very good in the breakfast department is one of the women clearing the tables etc. who was being unfairly rude to us (her name was Chantal M. ). Around the hotel there are a few restaurants (I recommend the Italian one, San Marino), cafés, a couple of small supermarkets, a petrol station and, most importantly, just around the corner there is a U-Bahnhof (an underground station) which is very very useful if you want to go into the center of Berlin. The hotel shares an underground parking with the small shopping center nextdoor. It's 13 euros per day though. We parked our car along the road in front of the hotel for 3 nights and 3 days, so we only payed 5 euros for the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in quiet residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Rayhelenquixkel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and tucked back into a quiet residential neighborhood. Had room on first floor. Restaurants nearby. Supermarket nearby. Pastry shop nearby. Not close to center city but close to Metro stop. Excellent breakfast buffet. Felt like part of a Berlin neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: walkermanic
Reviews.Content: Our apartment was spotlessly cleaned every day of our stay and we found the staff friendly and helpful. Our room number was 212, a very bright & airy apartment with a long outside balcony, equipped with table & chairs and a pleasant view onto the quiet street (Prager Strabe) below. Excellent choice and deliciously prepared breakfast buffet with attentive friendly and polite staff ready to bring fresh coffee/extra milk as required. The hotel is located in a quiet area away from the main road but within a few minutes walk of Guntzelstrabe underground entrance, linking to all major attractions & shopping areas. In hotel reception there are lots of tourist leaflets & maps. Also the reception area has the added bonus of a computer (with printer) available to guests and which proved very handy for printing off our boarding pass for the flight home. The hotel has a gym, pool & sauna, a good restaurant and bar although we preferred to walk around the corner to Rickenbackers Inn, a world famous music pub where we enjoyed live music and beer! On arrival to Tegel Berlin airport we got the X9 bus to the Zoological gardens and then walked to the hotel, a pleasant 15 minute stroll. We found it easy to walk to the centre of Berlin as well as travel on the underground/trains & buses. Excellent accommodation, good location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: packnandunpackn
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times and with each return to Berlin, we book the Ramada. The rooms are nice, free pass to Elixia fitness center, staff friendly and accommodating, location is great for subway travel. Parking garage reasonably priced. Good neighborhood restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: tessa0109
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days with my disabled mother (who was upgraded to a suite) and could not have had a more pleasant stay. The staff were very polite and helpful, the gym is fantastic, and the rooms were comfortable. I agree that the breakfast was expensive but about 10m from the hotel entrance starts a parade of shops that includes both restaurants and coffee shops and also a supermarket if you want to cook your own! Although I did find it a bit strange that there were no untensils in the small kitchenette so self-catering might have proved a bit problematic. The main shops were within easy walking distance for me (but not my mother) and the metro is close. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Berlin, nice location”
Reviews.Author: ruandrettert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a residential area, from the airport it takes around 20-30 minutes to get there. Taxi fare is 21,- EUR. There is a subway-station nearby in walking distance. However at the airport there is no subway! The rooms are big and comfortable. And I can not complain about the beds (have seen one review pointing that out). The bathroom looks quite new, there is a hair-dryer as well as free shampoo and soap. In the room there is mini bar and a safe. You can also iron your trousers. Internet is not free, you have to purchase an online hot-spot ticket which costs 8,- EUR per hour or 39,- EUR per month. If they provide special rates, I do not know. Breakfast is good, they have a huge selection of cold and hot things. They also make things like omletts on demand. Dinner is also good, you can eat a la carte or buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Plaza in West Berlin - Good Quality Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheekywelshmonkey
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nice welcoming staff. Good bar downstairs serving good quality bar meals. Close to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aub
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Plaza was an excellent hotel for sightseeing in Berlin. It is located very close to a Metro station that made travel to museums and attractions easy. It is located in a quiet area of tree-lined streets with plenty of good restaurants and sidewalk cares nearby. There is a nice small shopping center with 2 markets, bakery, pharmacy, etc and a small park across the way to sit and people-watch. The hotel itself is superb and service was very good. The breakfast buffet was abundant and tasty. This is one of my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with spacious rooms near subway”
Reviews.Author: VosBennebroek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, personnel was very friendly, we could check in ealy. Room was spacious and clean and included a balcony and view over the Prager Platz. Free wifi in the lounge. 3 minutes walk from the subway station, shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: flyingscotsman123
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ramada at 10am, check in was 2pm however we were given the keys to our room straight away. We had booked a superior room and we were not disappointed. we had a kingsize bed, a generous living room area and an amazing bathroom, which had the most beautiful free standing bath and a plasma screen where you could watch tv while you relaxed in the bubbles. The mini bar had a variety of drinks and snacks. The toileteries were standard, the towels and bathrobes were soft and fluffy and the complimentary slippers are still being used! Location was okay too, you can walk to the Kuffersdamn in around 20 minutes, but there is a sub way next to the hotel. There is a shell garage 2 mins from hotel it sells 6 bottles of beer for 9 euros which is good and has sandwiches etc. The hotel bar islovely but pricey two gin and tonics 16 euros! All in all it made our stay and if we go back to Berlin we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Angelo1975
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I've stayed in this hotel. Great hotel with an extremely helpfull and friendly staff. Excellent breakfast buffet and restaurant. We would recommand this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: germanyoften
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay in Berlin. I booked through the internet having reviewed the hotel through Trip Advisor first. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a very quiet and pleasant area with an excellent Italian Resturaunt nearby which is very affordable. The staff at the hotel were most helpful and pleasant. The rooms were quite spacious , very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and very substantial especially if one is touring the city all day. It is about ten minutes walk from the Ku. Dam but the taxi service is excellent when and if one is too tired to walk. I would certainly stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DebTheGerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter and granddaughter in a spacious suite. A travel cot, complete with pretty bedding, was thoughtfully provided for my granddaughter. The suite had a large bedroom, with a small balcony, a beautifully furnished living room, well-equipped bathroom and a kitchenette, with fridge and cooker. Everything was immaculate and cleaned every day. Extra little touches such as leaving chocolates and 'gummi bears' on our pillows each day, were more than welcome! Unusually for many hotels in Germany, the reception staff at the Ramada were very friendly and helpful. Restaurant staff were also good and my granddaughter received quite a few chocolate Santas during our stay. The breakfast buffet was also wonderful - with many and varied choices of food and drinks. The hotel reception was beautifully decorated for Christmas, with a tree and various delicacies such as Stollen and Fruits, Nuts, etc. were laid out for guests to sample. The hotel is also very well situated, with U-Bahn Station, Guntzelstrasse a few minutes walk through Prager Platz and then two stops on the train to Kurfurstendamm. I would very much recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a luxurious and comfortable stay in Berlin. Although pricey, it is well worth the money. It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice building, friendly staff. Shame about..”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: ...the bedding. Before I go there, let me point out the good aspects of my stay. *Clean, new hotel in a nice area *Two minutes from Guntzelsraβe U-Bahn station giving excellent public links to/from the rest of the city. *Surrounded by local shops and amenities *HARIBO gummy bears on the pillows instead of the usual chocolate mints - ok, small things make me happy ;) The hotel has a lot going for it. It's part of a new complex which also includes cafe's, a bakery, a deli, and a Aldi store (excellent for cheap snacks, toiletries and bottled water etc). It's also adjacent to a wholefoods store, and a Japanese canteen style restauraunt. There is a 24/7 Shell garage/store at the U-Bahn entrance on the corner also. Nearby public transport brings you everywhere you would want to go. The staff were efficient, if not over friendly (common enough in Germany, and not meant as any slight - everything is just businesslike), while the rooms were spacious and generally spotless. The downpoints for me were first and foremost, the beds. Both mornings of my stay I found myself in horrible pain. The matresses were like concrete slabs, and the pillows (which look soft, fluffly and inviting) collapse at the merest touch of your head and feel like you are resting on a bag of potatoes. So much thought has gone into the creation of this hotel and the decor - but comfortable bedding is something any hotel worth it's salt should have sorted out before opening. I've slept in more comfortable beds in basic chains like Travelodge previously..so a 4* Ramada Plaza surely should surpass their level of comfort. A final criticism was that the hotel tried to bill me for my stay upon check-out, despite the fact that I had pre-paid for my stay when booking. I do dislike when that happens because it makes the hotel look a little unorganised and unprofessional, and it leaves you with a lingering worry that 4/5 days down the line you're going to see a bill on your card for something that was already paid for. All in all - the Ramada Plaza has many good points, but really, it could do a lot better in some aspects. Would I return? Possibly, but only if the price was VERY right.

Reviews.Title: “Make use of the 3 days deal”
Reviews.Author: ZSh
Reviews.Content: Is an excelent deal of 3 days including an excelent breakfast (valued at 18 euro per person) ,one night dinner 3 course (aprox 40 euro) and 2 welcome cocktails (aprox. 20 euro) for 349 euro.If you make the calculations you get the room for 60 euro a night ,a real super bargain.You can order the deal just from Ramada site and it is only in german. They forgot to program my wake-up call and in general the reception people been not very nice. I get a superb 3 room suite and it was one of the best deals ever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spiritk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada in August 2007. Very nice Hotel. The rooms were beautiful and large. They were kept very clean. Now this Ramada is a bit out of the way of the main sights but the rail lines are very easy to use.. There was so much history in Berlin. Take the walking tours. They are great and are definitly the best way to see Berlin and take in all the History. One thing at the hotel, They told us what time breakfast was in the mornings, but did not tell use the cost. Well it ended up being 18 Euro.. Very expensive, so do eat breakfast outside of this hotel unless it is included in your room rate.. Overall this hotel was perfect. In a safe and Quiet area. I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to base yourself in the city”
Reviews.Author: enjoyslifeIreland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, in July this year and in February last year. On both occasions I found the hotel to be excellent. The rooms are nice and clean with lovely bathrooms and nice big showers. The staff are very professional and friendly. This hotel is ideally located to see the best of what Berlin has to offer. It is 2-3 minutes walk from the underground. The station is only 4 stops from the main Zoo station, and 2 stops from the Kaffurstendamm so getting around is easy. We stayed in an executive room on both occasions and I found them to be bigger than average for a city centre hotel. If you are going to Berlin I highly recommend a visit to the Pergamonn and to the main German Historical Museum on Unter den Linten. A visit to the food floor at the KaDeWe is a great experience, we had great sashimi at one of the sushi bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Frode
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderfull weekend in Berlin with my wife! This Hotel is exellent. It is situated at a small, quaint plaza with shops, bakeries, cafes and restaurants, and less than 100 meters from the underground, thereby giving quick and easy acess to the rest of the city. Our room was exellent, breakfast was good, and valuewise it was hard to beat. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missygee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easily accessable by U-bahn. My room was immaculate with comfortable down covers. The only problem was the bathroom. Only a tub/no shower. Nonetheless, I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed but kids were not allowed to use the pool”
Reviews.Author: salNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. location fine. yet there are a lot of hotels closer to town. Our problem was that we choose it so that the kids could swim in the lovely pool but when we arrived they told us that kids under 16 were not allowed and adults had to pay a daily charge. Our breakfast was extra £64 euros and we had paid 235 pounds for 2 nights for 2 adults and 2 kids sharing a sofa bed with no breakfast and no pool. Nevertheless the hotel was lovely and the underground was very close and we did enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “I can't sing its praises enough!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a truely lovely hotel which is made even more so by the lovely staff who couldnt do enough for us. Like another reviewer we booked through Expedia and had the same trouble when we arrived (the hotel being overbooked) but the hotel sent us to another hotel which was also a 4* and was approx 5 minutes from the Ramada Plaza and was a very nice hotel. The next day a taxi was sent to take us back to the Ramada Plaza and because of the inconvenience we were upgraded to a suite for the remainder of our holiday (6 nights) which was FANTASTIC. I will certainly be returning to Berlin if only to spend another week at this lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Plaza , Berlin”
Reviews.Author: RJM62
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Germany, stayed at the first class Ramada Plaza-Berlin. Excellent leafy location, first class hotel, service and staff. restaurant very good and reasonably priced. One of the best hotels we have stayed in anywhere, will definitely be back. Explore Berlin a city amongst cities!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Vienna_expat
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this hotel (and paid it in full) through Expedia. We also confirmed our stay. When I arrived, I was told that the hotel had "accidentally" overbooked due to a computer problem and did not have a room for us. They told us they would find another hotel of the same class, but the hotel which they found for us was old, the reception and lobby was dark and dreary and the hotel did not have any amenities (such as a pool). When I called the Ramada Plaza to tell them that the substitute hotel was unacceptable, they simply told me that there was nothing they could do as that was the last room in all of Berlin that they could find for us. While the staff at Ramada was very nice about helping us and paid the taxi ride to the next hotel, I find it unacceptable that the Ramada Plaza overbooked its rooms in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “impressive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff upon arrival were so polite, their english, luckily for us, was brilliant. They were helpful, showing us places of interest on a map and how to get there etc. The room was lovely, it was spacious, clean, everything we could possibly need. Although we had to be out of the hotel by 11 the next day, we had all day until our flight and the hotel allowed us to keep our luggage there until we needed to leave for the airport. so we had a luggage free walk around town. A big thank you to all the staff and we will definitely be going back
